channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump undermines his own pandemic response
These 5 principles could stop coronavirus surges, Fauci says
Trump promoted a doctor. See what she said about demons
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper discusses President Donald Trump's response to the coronavirus and a video he retweeted featuring a group of doctors making false claims about the coronavirus.

item.title: US to withdraw nearly 12,000 troops from Germany in move that will cost billions and take years
item.description: The US is to withdraw nearly 12,000 troops from Germany in a move that has attracted bipartisan congressional opposition and roiled key allies who see the move as a blow to NATO.

item.title: Four tech titans testify before Congress
Lawmakers push toxic disinfectant as Covid-19 treatment in Bolivia, against Health Ministry's warnings
item.description: The US and Brazil aren't the only countries where political leaders have appeared to contradict the advice of medical experts.

item.title: Unfortunately for Boris Johnson, much of Europe has moved on from Brexit
How Brett Kavanaugh tried to sidestep abortion and Trump financial docs cases
item.description: Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh urged his colleagues in a series of private memos this spring to consider avoiding decisions in major disputes over abortion and Democratic subpoenas for President Donald Trump's financial records, according to multiple sources familiar with the inner workings of the court.

item.title: Striking photos show a socially distanced Hajj
Boris Johnson: There are signs of a second coronavirus wave in Europe
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has warned of a second wave of coronavirus in Europe after the German government followed the UK in advising against travel to Spain.

item.title: Japan's air force faces a 'relentless' burden from China
Premier League star says he's 'scared' to open Instagram due to number of racist messages
item.description: Premier League star Wilfried Zaha admits he's "scared" to open Instagram due to the number of racist messages he receives.

item.title: President Trump walks out of briefing after CNN question
item.description: President Donald Trump abruptly ended his coronavirus briefing at the White House following a question about his tweets by CNN's Kaitlan Collins. Trump defended the tweets in support of hydroxychloroquine saying that the drug is still "very positive" and called a doctor who was spreading conspiracy theories on Covid-19 in a now deleted video "very impressive."

item.title: BBC journalist uses N-word in TV news report
item.description: Britain's public service broadcaster has come under fire after a news segment featuring an uncensored racial slur was aired on TV.

item.title: Video shows New York police pulling a woman into an unmarked van. She was wanted for damaging police cameras, police say
item.description: The New York City Police Department responded to a social media video that shows a woman being taken into custody Tuesday, saying she was wanted in connection with multiple instances of damage to police property.

item.title: A report says China is suspected of hacking the Vatican. Here's why
item.description: When you think about cyber espionage, the Vatican doesn't come to mind as an obvious target. It's a tiny country whose leader has more moral authority than worldly power.

item.title: Deal reached on withdrawing federal agents from Portland
item.description: The Trump administration has reached an agreement with Oregon's Democratic governor to withdraw federal officers from downtown Portland, though the Department of Homeland Security says it will maintain a presence in the city for the time being.

item.title: A landmark study shows what makes a successful relationship
item.description: It's not who you're with, but the dynamic you have with them.

item.title: Iran targets replica US aircraft carrier during military drills in Strait of Hormuz
item.description: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps struck mock targets, including a replica of a US aircraft carrier, on Tuesday night during military drills in the strategic Strait of Hormuz.

item.title: Desperation spreads across Bolivia: 'There are no doctors'
item.description: Bolivia has declared a "state of public calamity" due to the financial impact caused by Covid-19 as cases are on the rise throughout the country. CNN's Stefano Pozzebon reports.

item.title: NBA star claims coronavirus 'is being used for population control'
item.description: Denver Nuggets forward Michael Porter Jr. said during a Q&A session on Snapchat Tuesday that the coronavirus pandemic "is being used for population control" after a user asked him if the virus was being overblown to scare people into being controlled.

item.title: More than half of India's Mumbai slum residents may have been infected with Covid-19, study suggests
item.description: More than half of residents living in Mumbai's crowded slums may have contracted coronavirus and are likely being infected at a much higher rate than those not living in slum areas, a new study has found.

item.title: 'Outright quackery': CNN explains the right-wing media's conspiracy theories
item.description: CNN's John Avlon reports on the fringe conspiracy theories and misinformation that some conservative media outlets are spreading.

item.title: UK government invests in sex party startup
item.description: The British government is investing 170,000 ($221,780) in a company that throws sex parties.

item.title: Three Banksy paintings raise $2.9 million at auction for Palestinian hospital
item.description: Three Banksy paintings have been sold at auction for $2.9 million, with proceeds earmarked for a Palestinian hospital.

item.title: Critics fear Turkey's new social media law could hurt freedom of expression. Here's how
item.description: Turkey's parliament passed a bill on Wednesday that regulates social media content in what is being criticized by rights groups as "damaging" to freedom of expression. Here's what it all means.

item.title: CNN's Chris Cuomo: Trump gave us proof that we were right about him
item.description: President Trump wondered during a coronavirus press briefing why Dr. Anthony Fauci's approval rating was so high and his was so low. CNN's Chris Cuomo gives his take.

item.title: Epic 14-year road trip stalled in South America
item.description: For 14 years, nothing could stop road warriors Karen Catchpole and Eric Mohl. The New York couple with a bad case of wanderlust had rattled in their trusty Silverado from the top of the Western Hemisphere in Alaska to the bottom of South America and a host of places in between on an epic road trip.

item.title: Lamborghini's new supercar isn't legal to drive on public roads
See George Floyd hologram light up Confederate monument
item.description: The foundation created by George Floyd's family launched a new initiative to project a hologram of George Floyd at a handful of Confederate monuments throughout the South.

item.title: Simple Alzheimer's blood test moves closer to reality
item.description: A simple blood test to diagnose Alzheimer's disease -- on the wish list of many doctors, researchers and patients -- may be closer to becoming a reality, according to the results of studies presented virtually this week during the Alzheimer's Association International Conference 2020.

item.title: Train derailment and fire described as 'a scene from hell'
item.description: No injuries were reported when a Union Pacific train derailed and caught fire on a bridge over Tempe Town Lake in Arizona, officials said Wednesday.

item.title: NASA's X-15 is still the world's fastest manned aircraft
item.description: Rocketing at close to seven times the speed of sound and climbing as high as the edge of space, the X-15 first flew over 60 years ago but remains the fastest manned aircraft ever made.

item.title: We watched Zac Efron's new Netflix show so you don't have to
item.description: Binge-watching Netflix's "Down to Earth with Zac Efron" is sort of like watching Bill and Ted discover climate change.

item.title: Global air travel won't recover till 2024, says airline body
item.description: Global air travel won't recover from the Covid-19 crisis until 2024, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) announced Tuesday.

item.title: Kendall Jenner opens the doors to her bohemian LA home
item.description: Kendall Jenner may hail from one of America's most lavish celebrity families, but her Los Angeles home is more toned-down than you might expect.

item.title: Who needs a model anyway? Rembrandt self-portrait sells for record $18.7 million
item.description: A self-portrait by Rembrandt sold for 14.5 million ($18.7 million) at a virtual auction Tuesday -- a record price for a self-portrait by the Dutch master, according to auctioneer Sotheby's.

item.title: UFC President on sports in 2020: 'This isn't going to work outside of a bubble'
item.description: Dana White is nothing if not steadfast in his belief that he knows exactly what he is doing.

item.title: White supremacy is just the tip of the racism iceberg
item.description: W. Kamau Bell explains why white supremacists and neo-Nazi groups are only scratching the surface of systemic racism. Watch United Shades of America every Sunday at 10pm ET.

item.title: Drake breaks Billboard record thanks to DJ Khaled
item.description: Drake has officially dethroned Madonna thanks to a little help from DJ Khaled.

item.title: New Zealand mourns death of former All Blacks captain
item.description: The rugby world is paying tribute to Andy Haden, the former All Blacks captain who passed away on Wednesday aged 69.

item.title: How Toblerone chocolate became connected with air travel
item.description: Toblerone may not be the most famous chocolate brand in the world, but it's arguably the most iconic -- especially when it comes to travel.

item.title: Parents organize private proms during pandemic
item.description: HLN's Lynn Smith reports that some parents are organizing private proms for their teens after cancellations due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: In an extraordinary briefing room performance, Trump avoids most basic requirements of leadership in a crisis
item.description: VIDEO: Watch Trump walk out of briefing after CNN question LIVE UPDATES: India's coronavirus cases surpass 1.5 million

item.title: GOP congressman tests positive for Covid-19 at the White House
item.description: Rep. Louie Gohmert, a Texas Republican, has tested positive for coronavirus, a person familiar with the situation told CNN on Wednesday.

item.title: Doctors met with Pence after their group's video was removed
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence and members of his staff met Tuesday with some of the doctors who were featured in a video that was later removed from social media for misinformation, those doctors said on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump promotes a doctor who has claimed alien DNA was used in medical treatments
item.description: President Donald Trump vigorously defended his administration's handling of the coronavirus on Tuesday, but it was a series of questions from CNN's Kaitlan Collins about Dr. Stella Immanuel, a little-known Houston-based physician featured in a video the President retweeted, that caused him to abruptly end his press briefing.

item.title: Unfortunately for Johnson, much of Europe has moved on from Brexit
item.description: The UK is turning to the White House for inspiration on press briefings Germany advises against travel to Spain as warnings of second virus wave rise in Europe

item.title: Scam has Chinese students faking their own kidnappings
item.description: Australian police are warning of a new scam targeting Chinese students. They are asked to fake their own kidnappings to force their families to pay ransom money. CNN's Anna Coren reports.

item.title: Chinese warplanes put Japan's air force under relentless pressure
item.description: ANALYSIS: US-China relations are at an all time low, but Trump still seems unsure how to handle Beijing
